title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The solution curve must pass through the point (0,5), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D2E@ extend reasonably close to the left and right edges of the rectangle, and have no obvious conflicts with the given slope lines.

Only portions of the solution curve within the given slope field are considered.

The solution curve must lie entirely below the horizontal line segments at M=40. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGnbGaeyypa0JaaGinaiaaicdacaGGUaaaaa@3CFE@
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The value of the slope may appear in a tangent line equation or approximation.

A response of 5+ 35 4 ⋅2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FED@ is the minimal response to earn both points.

A response of 1 4 ( 40−5 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F8F@ earns the first point. If there are any subsequent errors in simplification, the response does not earn the second point.

In order to earn the second point the response must present an approximation found by using a tangent line that:

  • passes through the point (0,5) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaGGOaGaaGimaiaacYcacaaI1aGaaiykaaaa@3C7D@ and

  • has slope 35 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BA4@ or a nonzero slope that is declared to be the value of dM dt . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB9@

An unsupported approximation does not earn the second point.

The approximation need not be simplified, but the response does not earn the second point if the approximation is simplified incorrectly.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point is earned for either d 2 M d t 2 =− 1 4 ( 1 4 (40−M)) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@497C@ or d 2 M d t 2 =− 1 16 (40−M) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4758@ (or equivalent). A response that presents any subsequent simplification error does not earn the
second point.

A response that presents an expression for d 2 M d t 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E84@ in terms of dM dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CA9@ but fails to continue to an expression in terms of (i.e., d 2 M d t 2 =− 1 4 dM dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@45B7@ ) does not earn the first point but is eligible for the second point.

If the response presents an expression for d 2 M d t 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E84@ that is incorrect, the response is eligible for the second point only if the expression is a nonconstant linear function that is negative for 5<M<40. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EBF@

  • Special case: A response that presents d 2 M d t 2 = 1 16 (40−M) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4745@ does not earn the first point but is eligible to earn the second point for a consistent answer and reason.

To earn the second point a response must include d 2 M d t 2 <0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40FD@ or dM dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CA9@ is decreasing, or the graph of M MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGnbaaaa@39CD@ is concave down, as well as the conclusion that the approximation is an overestimate.

A response that presents an argument based on d 2 M d t 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E84@ or concavity at a single point does not earn the second point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.

The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

A response with no separation of variables earns 0 out of 4 points.

A response that presents an antiderivative of −ln(40−M) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@407D@ without absolute value symbols is eligible for all 4 points.

A response with no constant of integration can earn at most the first 2 points.

A response is eligible for the third point only if it has earned the first 2 points.

  • Special Case: A response that presents +ln(40−M)= t 4 +C MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44E9@ (or equivalent) does not earn the second point, is eligible for the third point, but not eligible for the fourth.

An eligible response earns the third point by correctly including the constant of integration in an equation and substituting 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIWaaaaa@39B6@ for t MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0baaaa@39F5@ and 5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaI1aaaaa@39BB@ for M. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGnbGaaiOlaaaa@3A80@

A response is eligible for the fourth point only if it has earned the first 3 points.

A response earns the fourth point only for an answer of M=40−35 e −  t 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4410@ or equivalent.
